Name: Bas-relief representing an offering to the god Min
Description: This fragment of relief shows a scene of offering to the god Min, patron of the towns of Coptos and of Akhmim. On the left part, one notices the hand of a person - probably the king - who presents a jar with incense. The facial features are very similar to those of the reliefs dating from the period of Senwosret I. This pharaoh had built several sanctuaries in Egypt and specifically at Coptos in favour of the god Min.
